alert.note: Alert for Menifee; Montgomery; Powell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 05 at 12:32PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Kentucky, including the following counties, Menifee, Montgomery and Powell. * WHEN...Until 330 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1230 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 3 hours. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area through 330 PM. This will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience minor flooding include... Stanton, Jeffersonville, Bean, Lucky Stop, Means, Cedar Groves, Clay Lick, Cornwell and Rothwell. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
